title: Amazon Stock Falls on Earnings Miss, Light Holiday Sales Outlook
text:
Amazon.com shares are sliding after hours Thursday after the e-commerce giant reported weaker-than-expected third-quarter results and provided lower-than-expected fourth-quarter sales guidance.

For the third quarter, Amazon (ticker: AMZN) posted sales of $70 billion, up 24% from a year ago, at the high end of the company’s guidance range of $66 billion to $70 billion and ahead of the Street consensus of $68.8 billion. But earnings of $4.23 a share were well below the consensus of $4.60 a share. Sales were up 24% in the U.S....
description: Amazon’s third-quarter earnings of $4.23 a share were well below the Street consensus of $4.60 a share.
